Stromburg High School has a six- period day. Periods are fifty minutes in length. Period one starts at 8:00 and school dismisses at 2:05 p.m. The teachers' work day is 7:30 to 3:05 p.m.    *      Most teachers at Stromburg High School teach 5 courses per semester.    *      Most teachers have two classes to prepare for and one planning period per day.      (A few teachers only have one prep but some have as many as three!)    *      Teachers will usually have at least one meeting per week after school hours.    *      The average number of students taught by each faculty member is around 160.

Faculty meetings occur at 2:15-3:30 p.m. on the third Wednesday of every month. The location is the school cafeteria.Topics addressed at meetings include curriculum initiatives  professional development  committee updates  discipline  school policy  state testing  release time  parent involvement  budget  student governance  and special events.The principal calls each meeting to order and opens the floor for announcements. To submit items for the meeting  contact Vice Principal Solanus by Friday of the week prior to the meeting.All faculty and staff are expected to attend staff meetings. Meetings usually generate lively  focused discussion. Staff members support the democratic process of meetings  engaging in constructive debate and voting for (or against) important items that could impact our school. The Stromburg staff is committed to contributing individual ideas while simultaneously working together to build consensus and a shared vision of the school.

Tenth Grade English: American Literature and CompositionAlthough by this age  most students are able to comprehend and learn from their reading  we believe that reading skills still need to be promoted  especially students' motivation to read in areas of interest that influence areas of current and future study. Period one starts at 8:00 and school dismisses at 2:05 p.m. The teachers' work day is 7:30 to 3:05 p.m.    *      Most teachers at Stromburg High School teach 5 courses per semester.    *      Most teachers have two classes to prepare for and one planning period per day.      (A few teachers only have one prep but some have as many as three!)    *      Teachers will usually have at least one meeting per week after school hours.    *      The average number of students taught by each faculty member is around 160.

Faculty meetings occur at 2:15-3:30 p.m. on the third Wednesday of every month. The location is the school cafeteria.Topics addressed at meetings include curriculum initiatives  professional development  committee updates  discipline  school policy  state testing  release time  parent involvement  budget  student governance  and special events.The principal calls each meeting to order and opens the floor for announcements. To submit items for the meeting  contact Vice Principal Solanus by Friday of the week prior to the meeting.All faculty and staff are expected to attend staff meetings. Meetings usually generate lively  focused discussion. Staff members support the democratic process of meetings  engaging in constructive debate and voting for (or against) important items that could impact our school. The Stromburg staff is committed to contributing individual ideas while simultaneously working together to build consensus and a shared vision of the school.
